message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the problem of subspace segmentation, which is a common problem in computer vision and machine learning. The paper proposes a new method called Correlation Adaptive Subspace Segmentation (CASS) using trace Lasso. This method is designed to balance the strengths of two existing methods, Sparse Subspace Clustering (SSC) and Low-Rank Representation (LRR), which are commonly used in subspace segmentation. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) and Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper involves the use of affinity matrices and data selection, which are common topics in Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) and Signal Processing (cs.SI). Finally, the paper also involves regularization techniques, which are commonly used in Information Theory (cs.IT).
